dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think the main issue with food is just personal health, but actually, it's deeply tied to environmental collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think the main issue with food is just personal health, but actually, it's deeply tied to environmental collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The way we produce and consume this food, meanwhile, damages Earths life-support system. It accounts for about one-quarter of greenhouse-gas emissions and is the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, and water extraction, leaving rivers dried out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the EAT-Lancet Commission really drove that home—37 scientists from 16 countries came together to tackle this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the E A T-Lancet Commission really drove that homeminus thirty seven scientists from sixteen countries came together to tackle this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two years ago, the EAT-Lancet Commission, comprising 37 scientists from 16 countries me included set out to provide an answer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, their report in The Lancet laid out, for the first time, scientific targets for both diets and global food production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, their report in The Lancet laid out, for the first time, scientific targets for both diets and global food production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our report identifies, for the first time, scientific targets for diets and the global food-production system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And one of the biggest takeaways was that feeding ten billion people sustainably by 2050 is actually possible, but it requires huge changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And one of the biggest takeaways was that feeding ten billion people sustainably by twenty fifty is actually possible, but it requires huge changes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big question is whether we can sustainably provide a healthy diet to a global population that is projected to reach ten billion by 2050. Our main conclusion, supported by reams of peer-reviewed evidence, is that feeding ten billion people on a sustainable planet is possible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like halving food waste, shifting to more efficient production, and—this is a big one—people eating way less red meat and dairy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like halving food waste, shifting to more efficient production, and-this is a big one-people eating way less red meat and dairy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It needs to halve the amount of food waste by 2050. It must move to more efficient and sustainable production systems and invest more in healthier crops. And people need to eat more fruit, vegetables, nuts, and legumes and reduce their dairy and red-meat consumption.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm, and more plant-based stuff. They even proposed a daily planetary health diet of around 2,500 calories, with ranges for each food group.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm, and more plant-based stuff. They even proposed a daily planetary health diet of around two thousand, five hundred calories, with ranges for each food group.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To achieve this, the Commission proposes a planetary health diet of 2,500 calories per day for an average global citizen leading an active life. The diet provides daily consumption ranges for different food groups (such as 200-600 grams of vegetables per day).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So like, 200 to 600 grams of vegetables per day? That's a lot more than most people are getting now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So like, two hundred to six hundred grams of vegetables per day? That's a lot more than most people are getting now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The diet provides daily consumption ranges for different food groups (such as 200-600 grams of vegetables per day).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they emphasized flexibility—this isn't about forcing everyone to go vegan. It can adapt to different cultures and cuisines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they emphasized flexibility-this isn't about forcing everyone to go vegan. It can adapt to different cultures and cuisines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We went to great lengths to stress that this diet is flexible and can be adapted to different cultures and different produce, whether Asian, European, African, or those of the Americas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But the resistance from certain industries has been pretty intense, huh? Like, uh, meat and dairy groups pushing back hard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the resistance from certain industries has been pretty intense, huh? Like, uh, meat and dairy groups pushing back hard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, several industry groups and other commentators have argued that meat and dairy are an important part of a nutritious diet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, but the science shows that reducing animal products could prevent up to 11 million premature deaths each year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, but the science shows that reducing animal products could prevent up to eleven million premature deaths each year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our analysis indicates that moving to such a balanced diet could prevent 11 million premature deaths per year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just about health though—the current system accounts for a quarter of greenhouse gas emissions. That's massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just about health though-the current system accounts for a quarter of greenhouse gas emissions. That's massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It accounts for about one-quarter of greenhouse-gas emissions and is the biggest cause of land-use change, biodiversity loss, and water extraction, leaving rivers dried out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And biodiversity loss, dried-up rivers… it's all connected. The report really stresses that sustainable production has to go hand-in-hand with dietary shifts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And biodiversity loss, dried-up rivers... it's all connected. The report really stresses that sustainable production has to go hand-in-hand with dietary shifts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is important to recognize that shifting to the planetary health diet will not in itself lead to sustainable production. We also need to improve how we produce what we eat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So whether it's large farms or small organic ones, everyone has a role to play in this transition happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So whether it's large farms or small organic ones, everyone has a role to play in this transition happen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Whether food producers operate large businesses, intensive farms, smallholdings, or organic farms, all can support the dietary and sustainability transition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it's gotta start with a real conversation—from farmers to consumers—about what we're eating and how it's produced.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it's gotta start with a real conversation-from farmers to consumers-about what we're eating and how it's produced.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, we want the report to start a discussion among all stakeholders from farmers to consumers about what we will be eating, and how we produce it, ten, 20, and 30 years from now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Because at the end of the day, the goal is a food system that supports both human health and the planet's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because at the end of the day, the goal is a food system that supports both human health and the planet's.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If we can do that, our food system can benefit, rather than harm, our own health and that of the planet.
